title: College Prep Test Scores
question_text:
Suppose $500$ females at a local high school took a college prep test this year. Below is the five-number summary of their scores:
Which of the following statements is true?

choices.text: About $250$ females at this high school scored greater than $28$.
This is a fairly symmetric distribution.
The student who scored $36$ is obviously an outlier.

solution:
By definition of the first quartile, about 25% of the data is less than 16; 25% percent of 500=125.

So, Choice 'D' is correct.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect; 28 is the third quartile, so only 125 females scored greater than 28.

Choice 'B' is incorrect; this distribution is not symmetric, as the distance from the median to the minimum is 7, but the distance from the median to the maximum is 15.

Choice 'C' is incorrect; by 1.5
*(IQR) method, 36
is not an outlier.

Choice 'E' is incorrect; rather, 125
females scored more than 28
.
